Spring JPA/Kaumei JDBC examples
=========================================


* do not touch jdbc-spring
* do not touch the pom.xml in those projects
* folder jdbc-spring-jpa: the JPA example
* folder jdbc-spring-kaumei: the **Kaumei&nbsp;JDBC** example

* table customers (e.g. restaurant owner)
  * id, long, unique, autogenerated
  * name, string, 50 chars, unique 

* restaurants
  * id, long, unique, autogenerated
  * name, string, 50 chars, unique 
  * address
  * customer_id, long, forgein key to customers.id

* table service_online_booking
  * id, long, forgein key to restaurants.id  
  * enabled, boolean
  * max_days_before, integer, mandatory
  * min_persons, integer, optional
  * need_phone_number, boolean, mandatory
* table service_accounting
  * id, long, forgein key to restaurants.id  
  * enabled, boolean
* table service_delivery_integration
  * id, long, forgein key to restaurants.id  
  * enabled, boolean
  * uber_id, string, 100 char, optional
  * lieferando_id, string, 100 char, optional
  * custom, string, 100 char, optional
* table service_feedback
  * id, long, forgein key to restaurants.id  
  * enabled, boolean
* table service_staff_scheduling
  * id, long, forgein key to restaurants.id  
  * enabled, boolean

Use cases:
* we need the JPA entities for 
* services:
  * create customer
    * input is a DTO not the entity
  * select from customers and restaurants by name
    * output is a DTO
* display alle services for a customer by restaurant
  * input the customer
  * output: list of DTO (restaurant name, booking:boolean, account:boolean, delivery:boolean, feedback:boolean,staff:boolean)
    * the service is enabled,disabled or absend
